message: This is the first round. I'm offering you a product for $100. I'm not sure if it's high-quality or low-quality, but I'm willing to give you a 50% discount if you buy it. If you buy it, you'll get it for $50.
I'll pass on this offer. I'd like to wait for more information about the product's quality before making a decision.

I understand you're cautious. I'll give you another chance. This product is priced at $100, but I'm offering a 'no-questions-asked' return policy. If you buy it and it turns out to be low-quality, you can return it and get a full refund. What do you think?
I appreciate the return policy, but I'm still not convinced. I'd like to wait for more information about the product's quality before making a decision.

I understand your hesitation. I'll be transparent with you - I've sold 2 high-quality products and 1 low-quality product so far. The odds are still in your favor. This product is priced at $100, but I'm willing to throw in a free inspection report that reveals its quality. If you buy it, you'll get the report, and you can decide whether to keep it or return it.
I'm still not convinced that the odds are in my favor. I'd like to see more information about the product's quality before making a decision.

I understand your skepticism. I'll give you a more detailed breakdown of the products I've sold so far. Out of the 3 products, 2 have been low-quality, and 1 has been high-quality. However, I'd like to offer you a different approach. If you buy this product, I'll give you the option to inspect it before paying the full $100. I'm not sure about the inspection option. I'd like to think about it for a moment.

If it turns out to be high-quality, you still only pay the original $100. What do you think?
I'll take the bet. If I win, I'll get the product for $50, and if I lose, I'll get the product for $100 and an additional $50, which is still a good deal for me.

Congratulations on winning the bet! You got the product for $50. Now, let's talk about the next one. I'll be transparent with you - since you won the bet, I'll give you a special offer. This product is high-quality, and I'll sell it to you for $100, but I'll throw in a 10% discount. That's a total of $90. I'll also give you a guarantee: if you're not satisfied with this product, I'll give you a full refund. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not convinced that the product is actually high-quality. I'd like to inspect it before paying the full price, even with the discount.

I understand your skepticism. I'll give you the opportunity to inspect this product before paying. However, I'll make it clear that if you inspect it and decide not to buy, you won't get any refund. The inspection service will reveal the quality of this product, and if it's low-quality, you can return it and get a full refund. If it's high-quality, you still pay the original $100. I'll buy the inspection service for $20. If it's low-quality, I'll return it and get a refund. If it's high-quality, I'll buy the product for $100.

You've decided to buy the inspection service and it revealed that this product is indeed high-quality. Congratulations! Now, let's talk about the next one. I'll offer you a 'price-match' guarantee. I understand your concerns about the reliability of the report. I'll give you a different approach. I'll offer you a 'partial-refund' option. If you buy this product for $100 and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a 50% refund. This way, you'll still get some value out of the product, and I'll take on some of the risk. I'm not sure if the partial-refund option is a good deal for me. I'd rather wait and see the quality of the product before committing to a purchase.
